summary.long: 2 Corinthians is a book of the New Testament.

verses.text:
From: Paul, an apostle of the Messiah Jesus by the will of God, and Timothy our brother.
To: God’s church in Corinth, and to all the holy people throughout Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May grace and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus, the Messiah, be yours!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Blessed be the God and Father of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah! He is our merciful Father and the God of all comfort,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who comforts us in all our suffering, so that we may be able to comfort others in all their suffering, as we ourselves are being comforted by God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For as the Messiah’s sufferings overflow into us, so also our comfort overflows through the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If we suffer, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort when you patiently endure the same sufferings that we are suffering.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Our hope for you is unshaken, because we know that as you share our sufferings, you also share our comfort.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not want you to be ignorant, brothers, about the suffering we experienced in Asia. We were so crushed beyond our ability to endure that we even despaired of living.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, we felt that we had received a death sentence so we would not rely on ourselves but on God, who raises the dead.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He has rescued us from a terrible death, and he will continue to rescue us. Yes, he is the one on whom we have set our hope, and he will rescue us again,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as you also help us by your prayers for us. Then many people will thank God on our behalf because of the favor shown us through the prayers of many.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this is what we boast about: Our conscience testifies that we have conducted ourselves in the world with pure motives and godly sincerity, without earthly wisdom but with God’s grace—especially toward you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For what we are writing you is nothing more than what you can read and also understand. I hope you will understand completely,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: just as you have already understood us partially, so that on the Day of our Lord Jesus we can be your reason to boast, even as you are ours.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because I was confident, I planned to come to you first so you might receive a double blessing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I planned to leave you in order to go to Macedonia, and then come back to you from Macedonia, and let you send me on to Judea.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I planned this, I did not do it lightly, did I? Are my plans so fickle that I can say “Yes” and “No” at the same time?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As certainly as God is faithful, we haven’t talked to you with mixed messages like that.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God’s Son, Jesus the Messiah, who was preached among you by us—by me, Silvanus, and Timothy—was not “Yes” and “No.” But with him it is always “Yes.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all God’s promises are “Yes” in him. And so through him we can say “Amen,” to the glory of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the one who makes us—and you as well—secure in union with the Messiah and has anointed us is God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has placed his seal on us and has given us the Spirit in our hearts as a down payment.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I call upon God as a witness on my behalf that it was in order to spare you that I did not return to Corinth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not that we are trying to rule over your faith, but rather to work with you for your joy, because you have been standing firm in the faith.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I decided not to pay you another painful visit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: After all, if I were to grieve you, who should make me happy but the person I am making sad?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is the very reason I wrote you, so that when I did come I might not be made sad by those who should have made me happy. For I had confidence that all of you would share the joy that I have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wrote to you out of great sorrow and anguish of heart—along with many tears—not to make you sad but to let you know how much love I have for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But if anyone has caused grief, he didn’t cause me any grief. To some extent—I don’t want to emphasize this too much—it has affected all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This punishment by the majority is severe enough for such a man.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So forgive and comfort him, or else he will drown in his excessive grief.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why I’m urging you to assure him of your love.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I had also written to you to see if you would stand the test and be obedient in every way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When you forgive someone, I do, too. Indeed, what I have forgiven—if there was anything to forgive—I did in the presence of the Messiah for your benefit,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: so that we may not be outsmarted by Satan. After all, we are not unaware of his intentions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I went to Troas on behalf of the gospel of the Messiah, the Lord opened a door for me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but my spirit could not find any relief, because I couldn’t find Titus, my brother. So I said goodbye to them and went on to Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God! He always leads us triumphantly by the Messiah and through us spreads everywhere the fragrance of knowing him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To God we are the aroma of the Messiah among those who are being saved and among those who are being lost.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To some people we are a deadly fragrance, while to others we are a living fragrance. Who is qualified for this?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At least we are not commercializing God’s word like so many others. Instead, we speak with sincerity in the Messiah’s name, like people who are sent from God and are accountable to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are we beginning to recommend ourselves again? Unlike some people, we do not need letters of recommendation to you or from you, do we?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are our letter, written in our hearts and known and read by everyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are demonstrating that you are the Messiah’s letter, produced by our service, written not with ink but with the Spirit of the living God, not on tablets of stone but on tablets of human hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such is the confidence that we have in God through the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: By ourselves we are not qualified to claim that anything comes from us. Rather, our credentials come from God,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: who has also qualified us to be ministers of a new covenant, which is not written but spiritual, because the written text brings death, but the Spirit gives life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now if the ministry of death that was inscribed in letters of stone came with such glory that the people of Israel could not gaze on Moses’ face (because the glory was fading away from it),
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: will not the Spirit’s ministry have even more glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the ministry of condemnation has glory, then the ministry of justification has an overwhelming glory.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In fact, that which once had glory lost its glory, because the other glory surpassed it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if that which fades away came through glory, how much more does that which is permanent have glory?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since we have such a hope, we speak very boldly,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: not like Moses, who kept covering his face with a veil to keep the people of Israel from gazing at the end of what was fading away.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, their minds were hardened, for to this day the same veil is still there when they read the old covenant. Only in union with the Messiah is that veil removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet even to this day, when Moses is read, a veil covers their hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But whenever a person turns to the Lord, the veil is removed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now the Lord is the Spirit, and where the Lord’s Spirit is, there is freedom.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As all of us reflect the glory of the Lord with unveiled faces, we are becoming more like him with ever-increasing glory by the Lord’s Spirit.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since we have this ministry through the mercy shown to us, we do not get discouraged.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, we have renounced secret and shameful ways. We do not use trickery or pervert God’s word. By clear statements of the truth we commend ourselves to everyone’s conscience before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if our gospel is veiled, it is veiled to those who are dying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In their case, the god of this world has blinded the minds of those who do not believe to keep them from seeing the light of the glorious gospel of the Messiah, who is the image of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we do not preach ourselves, but rather Jesus the Messiah as Lord, and ourselves as merely your servants for Jesus’ sake.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For God, who said, “Let light shine out of darkness,” has shone in our hearts to give us the light of the knowledge of God’s glory in the face of Jesus the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But we have this treasure in clay jars to show that its extraordinary power comes from God and not from us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In every way we’re troubled but not crushed, frustrated but not in despair,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: persecuted but not abandoned, struck down but not destroyed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are always carrying around the death of Jesus in our bodies, so that the life of Jesus may be clearly shown in our bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: While we are alive, we are constantly being handed over to death for Jesus’ sake, so that the life of Jesus may be clearly shown in our mortal bodies.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so death is at work in us, but life is at work in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now since we have the same spirit of faith in keeping with this Scripture: “I believed, and so I spoke,” we also believe and therefore speak.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that the one who raised the Lord Jesus will also raise us with Jesus and present us to God together with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All this is for your sake so that, as his grace spreads, more and more people will give thanks and glorify God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That’s why we are not discouraged. No, even if outwardly we are wearing out, inwardly we are being renewed each and every day.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This light, temporary nature of our suffering is producing for us an everlasting weight of glory, far beyond any comparison,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: because we do not look for things that can be seen but for things that cannot be seen. For things that can be seen are temporary, but things that cannot be seen are eternal.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We know that if the earthly tent we live in is torn down, we have a building in heaven that comes from God, an eternal house not built by human hands.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For in this one we sigh, since we long to put on our heavenly dwelling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of course, if we do put it on, we will not be found without a body.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So while we are still in this tent, we sigh under our burdens, because we do not want to put it off but to put it on, so that our dying bodies may be swallowed up by life.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God has prepared us for this and has given us his Spirit as a guarantee.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, we are always confident, and we know that as long as we are at home in this body we are away from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we live by faith, not by sight.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are confident, then, and would prefer to be away from this body and to live with the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So whether we are at home or away from home, our goal is to be pleasing to him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For all of us must appear before the judgment seat of the Messiah, so that each of us may receive what he deserves for what he has done in his body, whether good or worthless.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, since we know what it means to fear the Lord, we try to persuade people. We ourselves are perfectly known to God. I hope we are also really known to your consciences.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are not recommending ourselves to you again but are giving you a reason to be proud of us, so that you can answer those who are proud of outward things rather than inward character.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if we were crazy, it was for God; if we are sane, it is for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The love of the Messiah controls us, for we are convinced of this: that one person died for all people; therefore, all people have died.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He died for all people, so that those who live should no longer live for themselves but for the one who died and rose for them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So then, from now on we do not think of anyone from a human point of view. Even if we did think of the Messiah from a human point of view, we don’t think of him that way anymore.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, if anyone is in the Messiah, he is a new creation. Old things have disappeared, and—look!—all things have become new!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All of this comes from God, who has reconciled us to himself through the Messiah and has given us the ministry of reconciliation,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: for through the Messiah, God was reconciling the world to himself by not counting their sins against them. He has committed his message of reconciliation to us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, we are the Messiah’s representatives, as though God were pleading through us. We plead on the Messiah’s behalf: “Be reconciled to God!”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: God made the one who did not know sin to be sin for us, so that God’s righteousness would be produced in us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since, then, we are working with God, we plead with you not to accept God’s grace in vain.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
For he says,
“At the right time I heard you,
and on a day of salvation I helped you.”
Listen, now is really the “right time”! Now is the “day of salvation”!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We do not put an obstacle in anyone’s way. Otherwise, fault may be found with our ministry.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Instead, in every way we demonstrate that we are God’s servants by tremendous endurance in the midst of difficulties, hardships, and calamities;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in beatings, imprisonments, and riots; in hard work, sleepless nights, and hunger;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: with purity, knowledge, patience, and kindness; with the Holy Spirit, genuine love,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: truthful speech, and divine power; through the weapons of righteousness in the right and left hands;
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: through honor and dishonor; through ill repute and good repute; perceived as deceivers and yet true,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as unknown and yet well-known, as dying and yet—as you see—very much alive, as punished and yet not killed,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: as sorrowful and yet always rejoicing, as poor and yet enriching many, as having nothing and yet possessing everything.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have spoken frankly to you, Corinthians. Our hearts are wide open.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have not cut you off, but you have cut off your own feelings toward us.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Do us a favor—I ask you as my children—and open wide your hearts.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Stop becoming unevenly yoked with unbelievers. What partnership can righteousness have with lawlessness? What fellowship can light have with darkness?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: What harmony exists between the Messiah and Beliar, or what do a believer and an unbeliever have in common?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
What agreement can a temple of God make with idols? For we are the temple of the living God, just as God said:
“I will live and walk among them.
    I will be their God,
        and they will be my people.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
Therefore,
“Get away from them
    and separate yourselves from them,”
        declares the Lord,
“and don’t touch anything unclean.
    Then I will welcome you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
I will be your Father,
    and you will be my sons and daughters,”
        declares the Lord Almighty.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since we have these promises, dear friends, let’s cleanse ourselves from everything that contaminates body and spirit by becoming mature in our holy fear of God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Make room for us in your hearts! We have not treated anyone unjustly, harmed anyone, or cheated anyone.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not saying this to condemn you. I told you before that you are in our hearts to die together and to live together.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have great confidence in you. I am very proud of you. I am very much encouraged. I am overjoyed in all our troubles.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For even when we came to Macedonia, our bodies had no rest. We suffered in a number of ways. Outwardly there were conflicts, inwardly there were fears.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Yet God, who comforts those who feel miserable, comforted us by the arrival of Titus,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and not only by his arrival but also by the comfort he had received from you. He told us about your longing for me, your sorrow, and your eagerness to take my side, and this made me even happier.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I made you sad with my letter, I do not regret it, although I did regret it then. I see that the letter caused you sorrow, though only for a while.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I am happy, not because you had such sorrow, but because your sorrow led you to repent. For you were sorry in a godly way, and so you were not hurt by us in any way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For having sorrow in a godly way results in repentance that leads to salvation and leaves no regrets. But the sorrow of the world produces death.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: See what great earnestness godly sorrow has produced in you! How ready you are to clear yourselves, how indignant, how alarmed, how full of longing and enthusiasm, how eager to seek justice! In every way you have demonstrated that you are innocent in this matter.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So, even though I wrote to you, it wasn’t because of the man who did the wrong or because of the man who was hurt. Instead, I wrote to you so that your devotion to us might be made perfectly clear to you before God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This is what comforted us. In addition to our own comfort, we were even more delighted at the joy of Titus, because his spirit had been set at rest by all of you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if I have been doing some boasting about you to him, I have never been ashamed of it. Moreover, since everything we told you was true, our boasting to Titus has also proved to be true.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: His affection for you is even greater as he remembers how obedient all of you were and how you welcomed him with fear and trembling.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I rejoice that I can have complete confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We want you to know, brothers, about God’s grace that was given to the churches of Macedonia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In spite of their terrible ordeal of suffering, their abundant joy and deep poverty have led them to be abundantly generous.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I can testify that by their own free will they have given to the utmost of their ability, yes, even beyond their ability.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: They begged us earnestly for the privilege of participating in this ministry to the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We did not expect that! They gave themselves to the Lord first and then to us, since this was God’s will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So we urged Titus to finish this work of kindness among you in the same way that he had started it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Indeed, the more your faith, speech, knowledge, enthusiasm, and love for us increase, the more we want you to be rich in this work of kindness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am not commanding you but testing the genuineness of your love by the enthusiasm of others.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For you know the grace of our Lord Jesus, the Messiah. Although he was rich, for your sakes he became poor, so that you, through his poverty, might become rich.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am giving you my opinion on this matter because it will be helpful to you. Last year you were not only willing to do something, but had already started to do it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now finish what you began, so that your eagerness to do so may be matched by your eagerness to complete it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if the eagerness is there, the gift is acceptable according to what you have, not according to what you do not have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Not that others should have relief while you have hardship. Rather, it is a question of fairness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: At the present time, your surplus fills their need, so that their surplus may fill your need. In this way things are fair.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text:
As it is written,
“The person who had much did not have too much,
    and the person who had little did not have too little.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But thanks be to God, who placed in the heart of Titus the same dedication to you that I have.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: He welcomed my request and eagerly went to visit you by his own free will.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: With him we have sent the brother who is praised in all the churches for spreading the gospel.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: More than that, he has also been selected by the churches to travel with us while we are administering this work of kindness for the glory of the Lord and as evidence of our eagerness to help.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are trying to avoid any criticism of the way we are administering this great undertaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We intend to do what is right, not only in the sight of the Lord, but also in the sight of people.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We have also sent with them our brother whom we have often tested in many ways and found to be dedicated. At present he is more dedicated than ever because he has so much confidence in you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As for Titus, he is my partner and fellow worker on your behalf. Our brothers, emissaries from the churches, are bringing glory to the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, demonstrate to the churches that you love them and show them publicly why we boast about you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not need to write to you any further about the ministry to the saints.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For I know how willing you are, and I boast about you to the people of Macedonia, saying that Achaia has been ready since last year, and your enthusiasm has stimulated most of them.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I have sent the brothers so that our boasting about you in this matter may not prove to be an idle boast, and so that you may stand ready, just as I said.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Otherwise, if any Macedonians come with me and find out that you are not ready, we would be humiliated—to say nothing of you—in this undertaking.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Therefore, I thought it necessary to urge these brothers to visit you ahead of me, to make arrangements in advance for this gift you promised, and to have it ready as something given generously and not forced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Remember this: The person who sows sparingly will also reap sparingly, and the person who sows generously will also reap generously.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Each of you must give what you have decided in your heart, not with regret or under compulsion, since God loves a cheerful giver.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides, God is able to make every blessing of yours overflow for you, so that in every situation you will always have all you need for any good work.
verses.speaker: Narrator
Narrator

verses.text: Now he who supplies seed to the farmer and bread to eat will also supply you with seed and multiply it and enlarge the harvest that results from your righteousness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In every way you will grow richer and become even more generous, and this will cause others to give thanks to God because of us,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since this ministry you render is not only fully supplying the needs of the saints, it is also overflowing with more and more prayers of thanksgiving to God.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Because your service in giving proves your love, you will be glorifying God as you obey what your confession of the Messiah’s gospel demands, since you are generous in sharing with them and with everyone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And so in their prayers for you they will long for you because of God’s exceptional grace that was shown to you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Thanks be to God for his indescribable gift!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I myself, Paul, plead with you with the gentleness and kindness of the Messiah—I who am humble when I am face to face with you but forceful toward you when I am away!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I beg you that when I come I will not need to be courageous by daring to oppose some people who think that we are living according to the flesh.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Of course, we are living in the world, but we do not wage war in a world-like way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For the weapons of our warfare are not those of the world. Instead, they have the power of God to demolish fortresses. We tear down arguments
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: and every proud obstacle that is raised against the knowledge of God, taking every thought captive in order to obey the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Once your obedience is complete, we will be ready to reprimand every type of disobedience.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Look at the plain facts! If anyone is confident that he belongs to the Messiah, he should remind himself of this: Just as he belongs to the Messiah, so do we.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So if I boast a little too much about our authority, which the Lord gave us to build you up and not to tear you down, I will not be ashamed of it.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not want you to think that I am trying to frighten you with my letters.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For someone is saying, “His letters are impressive and forceful, but his bodily presence is weak and his speech contemptible.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Someone like this should take note of the following: What we say by letter when we are absent is what we will do when present!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We would not dare put ourselves in the same class with, or compare ourselves to, those who recommend themselves. Whenever they measure themselves by their own standards or compare themselves among themselves, they show how foolish they are.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We will not boast about what cannot be evaluated. Instead, we will stay within the field that God assigned us, so as to reach even you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For it is not as though we were overstepping our limits when we came to you. We were the first to reach you with the gospel of the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are not boasting about work done by others that cannot be evaluated. On the contrary, we cherish the hope that your faith may continue to grow and enlarge our sphere of action among you until it overflows.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Then we can preach the gospel in the regions far beyond you without boasting about things already accomplished by someone else.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: “The person who boasts should boast in the Lord.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: It is not the person who commends himself who is approved, but the person whom the Lord commends.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I wish you would tolerate a little of my foolishness. Yes, please tolerate me!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am jealous of you with God’s own jealousy, because I promised you in marriage to one husband, to present you as a pure virgin to the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, I am afraid that just as the serpent deceived Eve by its tricks, so your minds may somehow be lured away from sincere and pure devotion to the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For if someone comes along and preaches another Jesus than the one we preached, or should you receive a different spirit from the one you received or a different gospel from the one you accepted, you are all too willing to listen.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I do not think I’m inferior in any way to those “super-apostles.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Even though I may be untrained as an orator, I am not so in the field of knowledge. We have made this clear to all of you in every possible way.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Did I commit a sin when I humbled myself by proclaiming to you the gospel of God free of charge, so that you could be exalted?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I robbed other churches by accepting support from them in order to serve you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I was with you and needed something, I did not bother any of you, because our brothers who came from Macedonia supplied everything I needed. I kept myself from being a burden to you in any way, and I will continue to do so.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: As surely as the truth of the Messiah is in me, my boasting will not be silenced in the regions of Achaia.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Why? Because I do not love you? God knows that I do!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: But I will go on doing what I’m doing in order to deny an opportunity to those people who want an opportunity to be recognized as our equals in the work they are boasting about.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Such people are false apostles, dishonest workers who are masquerading as apostles of the Messiah.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: And no wonder, since Satan himself masquerades as an angel of light.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: So it is not surprising if his servants also masquerade as servants of righteousness. Their doom will match their deeds!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will say it again: No one should think that I am a fool. But if you do, then treat me like a fool so that I can also boast a little.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: When I talk as a confident boaster, I am not talking with the Lord’s authority but like a fool.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Since many people boast in a fleshly way, I will do it, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You are wise, so you will gladly be tolerant of fools.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: You tolerate anyone who makes you his slaves, devours what you have, takes what is yours, orders you around, or slaps your face!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am ashamed to admit it, but we have been too weak for that. Whatever anyone else dares to claim—I am talking like a fool—I can claim it, too.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they Hebrews? So am I. Are they Israelis? So am I. Are they among Abraham’s descendants? So am I.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Are they the Messiah’s servants? I am insane to talk like this, but I am a far better one! I have been involved in far greater efforts, far more imprisonments, countless beatings, and have faced death more than once.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Five times I received from the Jews 40 lashes minus one.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Three times I was beaten with a stick, once I was pelted with stones, three times I was shipwrecked, and I drifted on the sea for a day and a night.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have traveled extensively and have been endangered from rivers, robbers, my own people, and gentiles. I’ve also been in danger in the city, in the open country, at sea, from false brothers,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: in toil and hardship, through many a sleepless night, through hunger, thirst, many periods of fasting, coldness, and nakedness.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Besides everything else, I have a daily burden because of my anxiety about all the churches.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Who is weak without me being weak, too? Who is caused to stumble without me becoming indignant?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: If I must boast, I will boast about the things that show how weak I am.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The God and Father of the Lord Jesus, who is blessed forever, knows that I am not lying.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: In Damascus, the governor under King Aretas put guards around the city of Damascus to catch me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but I was let down in a basket through an opening in the wall and escaped from him.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I must boast, although it does not do any good. Let’s talk about visions and revelations from the Lord.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know a man who belongs to the Messiah. Fourteen years ago—whether in his body or outside of his body, I do not know, but God knows—that man was snatched away to the third heaven.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I know that this man—whether in his body or outside of his body, I do not know, but God knows—
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: was snatched away to Paradise and heard things that cannot be expressed in words, things that no human being has a right even to mention.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will boast about this man, but as for myself I will boast only about my weaknesses.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: However, if I did want to boast, I would not be a fool, because I would be telling the truth. But I am not going to do it in order to keep anyone from thinking more of me than what he sees and hears about me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: To keep me from becoming conceited because of the exceptional nature of these revelations, a thorn was given to me and placed in my body. It was Satan’s messenger to keep on tormenting me so that I would not become conceited.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I pleaded with the Lord three times to take it away from me,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: but he has told me, “My grace is all you need, because my power is perfected in weakness.” Therefore, I will most happily boast about my weaknesses, so that the Messiah’s power may rest on me.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: That is why I take such pleasure in weaknesses, insults, hardships, persecutions, and difficulties for the Messiah’s sake, for when I am weak, then I am strong.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have become a fool. You forced me to be one. Really, I should have been commended by you, for I am not in any way inferior to your “super-apostles,” even if I am nothing.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: The signs of an apostle were performed among you with utmost patience—signs, wonders, and powerful actions.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: How were you treated worse than the other churches, except that I did not bother you for help? Forgive me for this wrong!
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Now I’m ready to visit you for a third time, and I will not bother you for help. I do not want your things, but rather you yourselves. Children should not have to support their parents, but parents their children.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I will be very glad to spend my money and myself for you. Do you love me less because I love you so much?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Granting that I have not been a burden to you, was I a clever schemer who trapped you by some trick?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I did not take advantage of you through any of the men I sent you, did I?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I encouraged Titus to visit you, and I sent along with him the brother you know so well. Titus didn’t take advantage of you, did he? We conducted ourselves with the same spirit, didn’t we? We took the very same steps, didn’t we?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Have you been thinking all along that we are trying to defend ourselves before you? We are speaking before God in the authority of the Messiah, and everything, dear friends, is meant to build you up.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid that I may come and somehow find you not as I want to find you, and that you may find me not as you want to find me. Perhaps there will be quarreling, jealousy, anger, selfishness, slander, gossip, arrogance, and disorderly conduct.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I am afraid that when I come my God may again humble me before you and that I may have to grieve over many who formerly lived in sin and have not repented of their impurity, sexual immorality, and promiscuity that they once practiced.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: This will be the third time I am coming to you. “Every accusation must be verified by two or three witnesses.”
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I have already warned those who sinned previously and all the rest. Although I am absent now, I am warning them as I did on my second visit: If I come back, I will not spare you,
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: since you want proof that the Messiah is speaking through me. He is not weak in dealing with you but is making his power felt among you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Though he was crucified in weakness, he lives by God’s power. We are weak with him, but by God’s power we will live for you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Keep examining yourselves to see whether you are continuing in the faith. Test yourselves! You know, don’t you, that Jesus the Messiah lives in you? Could it be that you are failing the test?
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: I hope you will realize that we haven’t failed our test.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We pray to God that you will not do anything wrong—not to show that we have not failed the test, but so that you may do what is right, even if we seem to have failed.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For we cannot do anything against the truth, but only for the truth.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: We are glad when we are weak and you are strong. That is what we are praying for—your maturity.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: For this reason I am writing this while I am away from you: When I come I do not want to be severe in using the authority the Lord gave me to build you up and not to tear you down.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Finally, brothers, goodbye. Keep on growing to maturity. Keep listening to my appeals. Continue agreeing with each other and living in peace. Then the God of love and peace will be with you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: All the saints greet you.
verses.speaker: Narrator

verses.text: May the grace of the Lord Jesus the Messiah, the love of God, and the fellowship of the Holy Spirit be with all of you!
verses.speaker: Narrator
